name: Introduction to Forms part 1
text: In this video I setup the problems with forms and prepare you for a form walkthrough.

name: Introduction to Forms part 2
text: In this video we take a look at some forms and problems they can cause.

name: Overview of the Completed Page
text: In this video, you will see the completed form on desktop, tablet and smart phone. you will see how the keyboards are affected by the input type in some browsers.

name: Progress Bar
text: In this video, you will see how to implement the new progress bar.

name: Build a Form Part 1
text: In this video, you will see how to get started bulding an HTML5 form

name: Build a Form Part 2
text: In this video, you will see how to finishing coding the HTML5 form.

name: Style the Form
text: In this video, you will see how to use CSS to style the presentation of a form.

name: Building a Sprite in Photoshop
text: In this video, you will see the sprite I built on Photoshop and how it was built.

name: Implementing Pseudo Classes for Form Inputs
text: In this video, you will see the new psudo classes for forms being used with the sprite graphic.

name: Hooking up the FormToEmail.php File
text: In this video, you will see how to download, configure and implement a php file that send you an email from your website.

name: Giving Feedback with the Title Tag on Inputs
text: In this video, you will see a future development in providing feedback for required fields.

name: Introduction to Sliders
text: In this video you will see the completed version of the sliders page.

name: Setup the File
text: In this video you will see how access and setup the code for a basic slider. A link to the woo themes FlexSlider2 used in this course in located on the Spartan Design University website under section 7

name: Add a Caption to the Sliders
text: In this video you will see how to add captions to your sliders.

name: Customize the Sliders
text: In this video you will see how to customize the slider timing, direction and speed.

name: Overview of a Slider with Thumbnails
text: In this video you will see the completed thumbnail slider

name: Build a Slider with Thumbnails
text: In this video you will see how to build a thumbnail slider. A link to the woo themes FlexSlider2 used in this course in located on the Spartan Design University website under section 7

name: Overview of Flexible Video
text: In this video you will see the completed page for flexible videos

name: Build a Page with Flexible Video
text: In this video you will see how to build a flexible video page for youtube, vimeo and bliptv. A link to the FitVids.js used in this section in located on the Spartan Design University website under section 7

name: Overview of Sprites
text: In this video you will see a completed sprite used for social icons.

name: Creating a Sprite in Photoshop
text: In this video you will see how to build a sprite in Photoshop.

name: Coding a Sprite
text: In this video you will see how to code a social icons unordered list.

name: Styling a Sprite
text: In this video you will see how to style a sprite as a CSS background image.

name: Additional Options for Styling a Sprite
text: In this video you will see two additional options for presenting sprites.

name: Overview of Images and Font Graphics
text: In this video you will see an overview of this lesson on responsive images, twitter and font based icons.

name: Responsive Images using CSS and background-image
text: In this video you will see how to load different background images through CSS for phone, tablet, and desktop. This method has some advantages.

name: Responsive Images Using JavaScript
text: In this video you will use javascript to swam images based on the end users screen size. A link to the picturefill used in this tutorial in located on the Spartan Design University website under section 8

name: Embedding a Twitter Feed into a Responsive Column
text: In this video you will create a twitter feed from your account and then use a widget to display your feed into your own website.

name: Using Fonts for Social Media Icons
text: In this video you will use a font instead of graphics to insert social media icons onto your page. A link to the FontAwsome used in this tutorial in located on the Spartan Design University website under section 8

name: Using Structured Data for your Address and Contact Information
text: In this video you will learn to structure your contact and address information so it can be read by the Google Structured Data Test.
